title: Olymel S.E.C./L.P. Recalls Pork Products Produced Without Benefit of Inspection
summary: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14, 2017 Olymel S.E.C./ L.P., a Boucherville, Quebec, Canada establishment, is recalling approximately 1,124 pounds of pork ribs products because the products were repacked and distributed without the benefit of federal inspection, the U.S. Department of Agricultures Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS)...
impacted_products: 10-lb. cardboard box of pork rib tips with a packaging date of Jan. 10-13, 2017.
30-lb. cardboard box of pork rib tips with a packaging date of Jan. 10-13, 2017.
